com.arcrobotics.ftclib.hardware

Interface ServoEx

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HardwareDevice
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleServo

    public interface ServoEx
extends HardwareDevice
    An extended servo interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getAngle() 
      boolean getInverted() 
      double getPosition() 
      void rotate(double position)
      Rotates by a given positional factor.

      Rotates the servo a certain number of degrees.

      Sets the inversion factor of the servo.

      Sets the position of the servo to the specified location.

      Sets the range of the servo.

      Turns the servo position to a set angle.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.arcrobotics.ftclib.hardware.HardwareDevice

        disable, getDeviceType

    • Method Detail

      • rotateDegrees

        void rotateDegrees(double degrees)
        Rotates the servo a certain number of degrees.
        Parameters:
        degrees - The desired degrees of rotation

      • turnToAngle

        void turnToAngle(double angle)
        Turns the servo position to a set angle.
        Parameters:
        angle - The desired set position in degrees of the servo

      • rotate

        void rotate(double position)
        Rotates by a given positional factor.

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(double position)
        Sets the position of the servo to the specified location.
        Parameters:
        position - The location of the servo, which ranges from 0 to 1

      • setRange

        void setRange(double min,
              double max)
        Sets the range of the servo.
        Parameters:
        min - The minimum value. Setting the servo position to 0 will bring it to this specified minimum.
        max - The maximum value. Setting the servo position to 1 will bring it to this specified maximum.

      • setInverted

        void setInverted(boolean isInverted)
        Sets the inversion factor of the servo.

        By default, the inversion is false.

        Parameters:
        isInverted - the desired inversion factor

      • getInverted

        boolean getInverted()
        Returns:
        true if the servo is inverted, false otherwise

      • getPosition

        double getPosition()
        Returns:
        The current position of the servo from 0 to 1.

      • getAngle

        double getAngle()
        Returns:
        The angle the servo's current makes with the 0 position.
